title: Does a prequel make its original a sequel? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. A sequel has to be made after the film to which it is a sequel, and (as the name indicates) its events usually follow those of the previous film in time within the fictional universe. “Prequel” was coined to describe a sequel (made later and set in the same fictional continuity as a previous movie) that is set earlier in the fictional timeline. “Prequel” is a subtype of “sequel.” It does not cause the original movie to become its sequel, just as a “regular” sequel doesn’t cause its original movie to become a prequel.
I suppose, in the sense that the original story, featuring the same characters, is set later than the prequel, yes.
